macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Enters Bear Market Cycle Amid Declining Demand
items.summary: CryptoQuant data shows Bitcoin demand slowing since October 2025, with ETF holdings down 24,000 BTC in Q4 and price falling below the 365-day moving average of $98,172. Analysts note exhausted investment waves from ETFs, elections, and corporate allocations, with fearful market sentiment.

items.title: Bitcoin Falls Below $88,000 with 0.17% 24-Hour Drop
items.summary: Bitcoin traded at $87,998 on December 21, 2025, down 0.17% in the last 24 hours amid mixed sentiment and lower buying activity, following consolidation after a brief rally above $90,000.

items.title: Bitcoin Rebounds from $84,500 Despite $298M ETF Outflows
items.summary: Bitcoin rebounded after Bank of Japan eased yen carry trade fears, supported by Fed rate-cut hopes and crypto legislation progress, though December ETF outflows total $298.2M. Analysts target $150,000 in 6-12 months amid extreme fear signaling a potential buying opportunity.

items.title: Crypto Whale Transfers $3.08M in LINK from Binance
items.summary: A major crypto whale moved $3.08 million worth of Chainlink (LINK) off Binance, drawing market scrutiny amid broader volatility discussions including Bitcoin's slump below its 365-day average.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces $70K Correction Before $100K Target as Whales Accumulate
items.summary: Experts predict a potential drop to $70K testing the 50-day MA, but strong whale accumulation at $90K levels signals confidence, with medium-term targets at $100K by Q1 2026 and long-term up to $200K.

items.title: Bitcoin's Failure to Reclaim $90K Reveals 30% Drop in Market Depth
items.summary: Kaiko data indicates Bitcoin's aggregated 2% market depth has declined 30% from 2025 highs, exposing structural weakness that could trap investors in the next unwind as it struggles above $90,000.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NCSC CTO weekly summary highlights AI-related cyber campaigns and research on LLM backdoors
items.summary: The CTO at NCSC weekly roundup notes sustained targeting of global infrastructure (2021–2025) with emphasis on the energy sector and summarizes recent AI security research including inductive backdoors in LLMs and memory-injection attacks on LLM agents published by academic teams and industry collaborators[1].

items.title: QConAI NY: Designing AI platforms for reliability — agents as engineering, not prompt craft
items.summary: At QConAI NYC, speaker Aaron Erickson argued agentic AI should be engineered as layered systems combining probabilistic models and deterministic boundaries to improve reliability, stressing tooling, constrained interfaces, and telemetry as key platform concerns[2].

items.title: Debate over regulating AI intensifies as legal and ethical concerns mount
items.summary: An analysis piece examines accelerating calls for AI regulation, discussing risks such as job displacement, inequality, and harms from biased data while surveying views from leading researchers and policymakers about the need for legal frameworks[3].

items.title: Hybrid ML approach improves stroke prediction in clinical dataset
items.summary: A new study presents a hybrid IGR–KNN–DNN pipeline for early stroke-risk prediction on the Cardiovascular Health Study dataset, reporting high internal-validation metrics (accuracy ~94.3%, F1 ~95%) while noting the need for external validation[4].

items.title: Report: China develops prototype AI-capable semiconductor production machine
items.summary: Reuters reporting summarized in the weekly roundup indicates Chinese researchers built a prototype machine for producing advanced semiconductors used in AI and other technologies, framing it as part of a national effort to rival Western chip capabilities[1].
items.source: Reuters (summarized in CTO at NCSC roundup)

items.title: Workplace skills shift: prompting and 'AI literacy' become core job skills
items.summary: Coverage highlights that concise, effective instruction of AI systems—often termed prompting or AI literacy—is increasingly treated as a critical workplace skill that will differentiate employees[5].

items.title: Cisco emphasizes infrastructure needs as AI workloads grow
items.summary: Cisco newsroom pieces emphasize that AI's demands for speed, bandwidth, and energy are stressing organizational infrastructure and outline Cisco's positioning to help customers capture AI value securely and efficiently[6].

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Hunter x Hunter Nen x Impact Adds DLC Character Phinks on December 25
items.summary: Arc System Works announced that the Hunter x Hunter Nen x Impact fighting game will release DLC character Phinks on December 25 as part of Season Pass 1. Phinks is the second of four characters, following Neferpitou, with two more planned for spring and summer 2026.

items.title: Xbox Countdown Sale 2025 Offers 90-95% Discounts on 50+ Games
items.summary: The Xbox Countdown Sale features massive discounts of 90-95% on over 50 titles, including Dragon Age: Inquisition, Mass Effect Legendary Edition, and Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order. The sale includes around 2,000 games total, accessible via the Microsoft Store on Xbox.

items.title: Epic Games Christmas Freebie Revealed as Blood West
items.summary: The latest Epic Games Christmas Mystery Freebie is Blood West, a dark western FPS with very positive ratings, available now despite not matching circulating leak lists.

items.title: Free Vampire Survivors-Like Game Available on Steam Until December 31
items.summary: A Vampire Survivors-inspired game is free on Steam for all users until December 31, 2025, at 18:00 UTC.

items.title: IndieGala Offers Free Christmas-Themed Jigsaw Puzzle Game
items.summary: IndieGala is giving away a festive jigsaw puzzle game featuring 25 Christmas-themed puzzles of varying sizes.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung and SK hynix Ramp Up Memory Chip Production
items.summary: Korean chipmakers Samsung Electronics and SK hynix are accelerating memory output, including DRAM, NAND flash, and high bandwidth memory, to meet surging demand from AI servers. Samsung is resuming construction on its Line 5 facility for 2028 operations, while SK hynix advances its M15X plant and Yongin cluster.

items.title: Ethiopia Launches Digital Ethiopia 2030 Strategy
items.summary: Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed announced the completion of Digital Ethiopia 2025 and launched Digital Ethiopia 2030, focusing on expanding digital services, infrastructure, and public service efficiency to drive national development.

items.title: US Proposes $112 Billion Project Sunrise to Rebuild Gaza as High-Tech Metropolis
items.summary: US envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner pitched a 20-year, $112 billion plan to Qatar, UAE, Egypt, and Turkey to transform Gaza into a high-tech hub starting with Rafah as an administrative center for over 500,000 residents.
